title: Looking for any faces that have a "y" w/ a notch where the two strokes join
content:
I'm looking for any faces that have a lower case y like the one in neo sans

[http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=neo+sans&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=a%20%22y%...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820124139/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=neo+sans&x=0&y=0&sample_text=a%20%22y%22%20%20like%20this&sample_size=36 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=neo+sans&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=a%20%22y%22%20%20like%20this&sample\_size=36")

Specifically the notch where the two bars come together

Thanks
author: voiceof

comments.content:
Fedra, FF Typestar, FF Meta, FF Signa, Modus, Klavika -- just to add some more.

- Mike Yanega
Miss Tiff means to say anything from Erik Spiekermann ;-)

I don’t know how permissive you are …  
Is [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820124139/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/eurostile_lt_std_medium_ot/?sample_text=a%20%E2%80%98y%E2%80%99%20like%20this&sample_size=36&acs_ss=-1&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1)’s ‘y’ still okay?  
Several fonts by [Jos Buivenga](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820124139/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jos%20Buivenga) have this feature too, i.e. [Anivers, Fertigo & Fontin](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820124139/http:/www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/).  
And [Friz □](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820124139/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=friz&x=0&y=0&sample_text=a%20%E2%80%98y%E2%80%99%20like%20this&sample_size=36), albeit very subtle.
@Jan: Exactly. ;^) My textexpander quick key for href had stopped working so I was being terribly lazy. (I hate it when the registration clears on something which you've already paid.)

Thanks for all the suggestions.

_"Is Eurostile’s ‘y’ still okay?"_

I'm working on a possible wordmark so right now I'm looking for anything I can find. I liked the general feel that neo sans gave but I wanted something a little wider that it offered.
